content:
EnumerableRowCollection<TRow> Class

Definition

Represents a collection of DataRow objects returned from a query. This API supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

In this Article

public class EnumerableRowCollection<TRow> : System.Data.EnumerableRowCollection, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<TRow>

Type Parameters

TRow

The type of objects in the source sequence, typically DataRow.
Inheritance
Object
EnumerableRowCollection
EnumerableRowCollection<TRow>
Derived
OrderedEnumerableRowCollection<TRow>

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Remarks

EnumerableRowCollection(TRow) is used to contain the results of a LINQ to DataSet query.

An EnumerableRowCollection(TRow) cannot be directly instantiated because there are no public constructors for this class.

Methods

GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator for the collection of contained row objects. This API supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<TRow> GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator<TRow>

A strongly-typed stem.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1 that can be used to traverse the collection of TRow objects.

Remarks

When used with LINQ to DataSet queries, Trow will be of type DataRow.

This method cannot be overridden.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator for the collection of DataRow objects. This API supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An IEnumerator that can be used to traverse the collection of DataRow objects.

Remarks

This method calls the GetEnumerator method.

This method cannot be overridden.
